intro: Manilkara balata, commonly known as the rubber tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and large, elliptical leaves. The tree produces a milky latex sap, which has been historically used for rubber production. Its fruits are small, round, and turn from green to yellow when mature. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in its native habitats.
